alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Johnston; Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 23 at 2:00PM EDT until September 23 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR FRANKLIN, JOHNSTON AND WAKE COUNTIES... At 200 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Raleigh, Cary, Smithfield, Louisburg, Wake Forest, Garner, Fuquay-Varina, Clayton, Zebulon, Angier, Benson, Bunn, Apex, Holly Springs, Knightdale, Micro, Selma, Wendell, Rolesville and Four Oaks. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
